channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Adapting to Non-Stationary Environments: Multi-Armed Bandit Enhanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation on Knowledge Graphs
item.description: The system utilizes real-time user feedback to adapt to dynamic environments, by selecting the appropriate retrieval method based on input queries and the historical multi-objective performance of each arm.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Policy as Macro Regulator Rather than Macro Placer
item.description: In modern chip design, placement aims at placing millions of circuit modules, which is an essential step that significantly influences power, performance, and area (PPA) metrics.

item.title: Video Motion Transfer with Diffusion Transformers
item.description: We propose DiTFlow, a method for transferring the motion of a reference video to a newly synthesized one, designed specifically for Diffusion Transformers (DiT).

item.title: Granite Guardian
item.description: We introduce the Granite Guardian models, a suite of safeguards designed to provide risk detection for prompts and responses, enabling safe and responsible use in combination with any large language model (LLM).

item.title: StoryWeaver: A Unified World Model for Knowledge-Enhanced Story Character Customization
item.description: Story visualization has gained increasing attention in artificial intelligence.

item.title: QAPyramid: Fine-grained Evaluation of Content Selection for Text Summarization
item.description: The Pyramid human evaluation protocol, which assesses content selection by breaking the reference summary into sub-units and verifying their presence in the system summary, has been widely adopted.

item.title: Post-Training Statistical Calibration for Higher Activation Sparsity
item.description: We present Statistical Calibrated Activation Pruning (SCAP), a post-training activation pruning framework that (1) generalizes sparsification by input activations of Fully-Connected layers for generic and flexible application across Transformers, and (2) features a simple Mode-Centering technique to pre-calibrate activation distributions for maximizing post-training sparsity.

item.title: Unlocking the Potential of Reverse Distillation for Anomaly Detection
item.description: Knowledge Distillation (KD) is a promising approach for unsupervised Anomaly Detection (AD).

item.title: Temporal Linear Item-Item Model for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: However, they solely deal with the sequential order of items (i. e., sequential information) and overlook the actual timestamp (i. e., temporal information).

item.title: Motion Artifact Removal in Pixel-Frequency Domain via Alternate Masks and Diffusion Model
item.description: Motion artifacts present in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) can seriously interfere with clinical diagnosis.

item.title: Bayesian Optimization of Antibodies Informed by a Generative Model of Evolving Sequences
item.description: To build effective therapeutics, biologists iteratively mutate antibody sequences to improve binding and stability.

item.title: Reconstructing Deep Neural Networks: Unleashing the Optimization Potential of Natural Gradient Descent
item.description: Natural gradient descent (NGD) is a powerful optimization technique for machine learning, but the computational complexity of the inverse Fisher information matrix limits its application in training deep neural networks.

item.title: A Parametric Approach to Adversarial Augmentation for Cross-Domain Iris Presentation Attack Detection
item.description: Iris-based biometric systems are vulnerable to presentation attacks (PAs), where adversaries present physical artifacts (e. g., printed iris images, textured contact lenses) to defeat the system.

item.title: OmniDocBench: Benchmarking Diverse PDF Document Parsing with Comprehensive Annotations
item.description: Document content extraction is crucial in computer vision, especially for meeting the high-quality data needs of large language models (LLMs) and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) technologies.

item.title: SmartAgent: Chain-of-User-Thought for Embodied Personalized Agent in Cyber World
item.description: To address this, we propose Chain-of-User-Thought (COUT), a novel embodied reasoning paradigm that takes a chain of thought from basic action thinking to explicit and implicit personalized preference thought to incorporate personalized factors into autonomous agent learning.

item.title: DriveMM: All-in-One Large Multimodal Model for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) have demonstrated exceptional comprehension and interpretation capabilities in Autonomous Driving (AD) by incorporating large language models.

item.title: Enhancing Relation Extraction via Supervised Rationale Verification and Feedback
item.description: Despite the rapid progress that existing automated feedback methods have made in correcting the output of large language models (LLMs), these methods cannot be well applied to the relation extraction (RE) task due to their designated feedback objectives and correction manner.

item.title: CBraMod: A Criss-Cross Brain Foundation Model for EEG Decoding
item.description: Secondly, existing EEG foundation models have limited generalizability on a wide range of downstream BCI tasks due to varying formats of EEG data, making it challenging to adapt to.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks Are More Than Filters: Revisiting and Benchmarking from A Spectral Perspective
item.description: To demystify such a conflict, this paper introduces a comprehensive benchmark to measure and evaluate GNNs' capability in capturing and leveraging the information encoded in different frequency components of the input graph data.

item.title: Modeling Dual-Exposure Quad-Bayer Patterns for Joint Denoising and Deblurring
item.description: Long exposures reduce noise but introduce blur.

item.title: Towards Automated Cross-domain Exploratory Data Analysis through Large Language Models
item.description: Exploratory data analysis (EDA), coupled with SQL, is essential for data analysts involved in data exploration and analysis.

item.title: Bridging the Gap for Test-Time Multimodal Sentiment Analysis
item.description: However, in real-world dynamic scenarios, the distribution of target data is always changing and different from the source data used to train the model, which leads to performance degradation.

item.title: FireFlow: Fast Inversion of Rectified Flow for Image Semantic Editing
item.description: Though Rectified Flows (ReFlows) with distillation offers a promising way for fast sampling, its fast inversion transforms images back to structured noise for recovery and following editing remains unsolved.

item.title: DiffCLIP: Few-shot Language-driven Multimodal Classifier
item.description: To tackle this issue, we introduce DiffCLIP, a novel framework that extends CLIP to effectively convey comprehensive language-driven semantic information for accurate classification of high-dimensional multimodal remote sensing images.

item.title: ACDiT: Interpolating Autoregressive Conditional Modeling and Diffusion Transformer
item.description: The analysis of the trade-off between autoregressive modeling and diffusion demonstrates the potential of ACDiT to be used in long-horizon visual generation tasks.

item.title: Taylor Outlier Exposure
item.description: However, constructing clean auxiliary OOD datasets, uncontaminated by in-distribution (ID) samples, is essential for OE; generally, a noisy OOD dataset contaminated with ID samples negatively impacts OE training dynamics and final detection performance.

item.title: Bayesian Data Augmentation and Training for Perception DNN in Autonomous Aerial Vehicles
item.description: However, synthetic data generation solutions for aerial vehicles are still lacking.

item.title: A New Federated Learning Framework Against Gradient Inversion Attacks
item.description: By revisiting the key to privacy exposure in FL under GIA, which lies in the frequent sharing of model gradients that contain private data, we take a new perspective by designing a novel privacy preserve FL framework that effectively ``breaks the direct connection'' between the shared parameters and the local private data to defend against GIA.

item.title: Maya: An Instruction Finetuned Multilingual Multimodal Model
item.description: The rapid development of large Vision-Language Models (VLMs) has led to impressive results on academic benchmarks, primarily in widely spoken languages.

item.title: Frame Representation Hypothesis: Multi-Token LLM Interpretability and Concept-Guided Text Generation
item.description: Interpretability is a key challenge in fostering trust for Large Language Models (LLMs), which stems from the complexity of extracting reasoning from model's parameters.

item.title: IntellectSeeker: A Personalized Literature Management System with the Probabilistic Model and Large Language Model
item.description: We introduce IntellectSeeker, an innovative and personalized intelligent academic literature management platform to address these challenges.

item.title: ArtFormer: Controllable Generation of Diverse 3D Articulated Objects
item.description: This paper presents a novel framework for modeling and conditional generation of 3D articulated objects.

item.title: HARP: Hesitation-Aware Reframing in Transformer Inference Pass
item.description: This paper aims to improve the performance of large language models by addressing the variable computational demands in inference steps, where some tokens require more computational resources than others.

item.title: RFL: Simplifying Chemical Structure Recognition with Ring-Free Language
item.description: The primary objective of Optical Chemical Structure Recognition is to identify chemical structure images into corresponding markup sequences.

item.title: Hallucination Elimination and Semantic Enhancement Framework for Vision-Language Models in Traffic Scenarios
item.description: Large vision-language models (LVLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in multimodal understanding and generation tasks.

item.title: A data-driven learned discretization approach in finite volume schemes for hyperbolic conservation laws and varying boundary conditions
item.description: We extend this approach to flux-limited finite volume schemes for hyperbolic scalar and systems of conservation laws.

item.title: Scaling Sequential Recommendation Models with Transformers
item.description: The nature of the problem, as well as the good performance observed across various domains, has motivated the use of the transformer architecture, which has proven effective in leveraging increasingly larger amounts of training data when accompanied by an increase in the number of model parameters.

item.title: A Method for Evaluating Hyperparameter Sensitivity in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The performance of modern reinforcement learning algorithms critically relies on tuning ever-increasing numbers of hyperparameters.

item.title: EvRepSL: Event-Stream Representation via Self-Supervised Learning for Event-Based Vision
item.description: However, most of the state-of-the-art event-stream representations are manually designed and the quality of these representations cannot be guaranteed due to the noisy nature of event-streams.

item.title: PTSBench: A Comprehensive Post-Training Sparsity Benchmark Towards Algorithms and Models
item.description: Our PTSBench can provide (1) new observations for a better understanding of the PTS algorithms, (2) in-depth and comprehensive evaluations for the sparsification ability of models, and (3) a well-structured and easy-integrate open-source framework.

item.title: SynCamMaster: Synchronizing Multi-Camera Video Generation from Diverse Viewpoints
item.description: Recent advancements in video diffusion models have shown exceptional abilities in simulating real-world dynamics and maintaining 3D consistency.

item.title: Monte Carlo Tree Search based Space Transfer for Black-box Optimization
item.description: MCTS-transfer can not only provide a well-performing search space for warm-start but also adaptively identify and leverage the information of similar source tasks to reconstruct the search space during the optimization process.

item.title: MM-PoE: Multiple Choice Reasoning via. Process of Elimination using Multi-Modal Models
item.description: Critically, this approach not only broadens the application of the elimination process to multi-modal contexts but also allows few-shot experiments, thereby addressing two principal limitations concerning usage of PoE only in zero-shot settings and only with a language-only framework.

item.title: GraphNeuralNetworks.jl: Deep Learning on Graphs with Julia
item.description: GraphNeuralNetworks. jl is an open-source framework for deep learning on graphs, written in the Julia programming language.

item.title: AutoReason: Automatic Few-Shot Reasoning Decomposition
item.description: Chain of Thought (CoT) was introduced in recent research as a method for improving step-by-step reasoning in Large Language Models.

item.title: Learnable Evolutionary Multi-Objective Combinatorial Optimization via Sequence-to-Sequence Model
item.description: Recent advances in learnable evolutionary algorithms have demonstrated the importance of leveraging population distribution information and historical evolutionary trajectories.

item.title: SimuDICE: Offline Policy Optimization Through World Model Updates and DICE Estimation
item.description: In offline reinforcement learning, deriving an effective policy from a pre-collected set of experiences is challenging due to the distribution mismatch between the target policy and the behavioral policy used to collect the data, as well as the limited sample size.

item.title: CURE: Clinical Understanding & Retrieval Evaluation
item.description: Given the dominance of dense retrievers that do not generalize well beyond their training dataset distributions, domain-specific test sets are essential in evaluating retrieval.

item.title: VOPy: A Framework for Black-box Vector Optimization
item.description: We introduce VOPy, an open-source Python library designed to address black-box vector optimization, where multiple objectives must be optimized simultaneously with respect to a partial order induced by a convex cone.

item.title: Splatter-360: Generalizable 360$^{\circ}$ Gaussian Splatting for Wide-baseline Panoramic Images
item.description: Wide-baseline panoramic images are frequently used in applications like VR and simulations to minimize capturing labor costs and storage needs.
